Nezaketsiz davrandıysam, bu nezaketsiz davranmak için yeterli sebep değil midir? Ama başka sebeplerim de var. Biliyorsunuz, var. Size karşı kendi duygularım olumsuz olmasaydı, kayıtsız olsaydı, ya da olumlu olsaydı bile biricik ablamın mutluluğunu belki de ilelebet harap eden adamı herhangi bir nedenle kabul eder miydim sanıyorsunuz?
es: ––También podría yo replicó Elizabeth–– preguntar por qué con tan evidente propósito de ofenderme y de insultarme me dice que le gusto en contra de su voluntad, contra su buen juicio y hasta contra su modo de ser. ¿No es ésta una excusa para mi falta de cortesía, si es que en realidad la he cometido? Pero, además, he recibido otras provocaciones, lo sabe usted muy bien. Aunque mis sentimientos no hubiesen sido contrarios a los suyos, aunque hubiesen sido indiferentes o incluso favorables, ¿cree usted que habría algo que pudiese tentarme a aceptar al hombre que ha sido el culpable de arruinar, tal vez para siempre, la felicidad de una hermana muy querida?
vi_translation: She replied: - And I also want to ask why, with such a clear intention to insult and humiliate me, you want to tell me that you go against your will, against your reason, even against your nature, to love me? Is this an excuse for being rude, if I have been rude? But I have other provocations. You know that very well. If my feelings were not opposed to you, if I had different feelings, or even favorable feelings, do you think that any consideration would lead me to accept a person who intended to destroy, perhaps for the rest of their life, the happiness of the sister I love the most?
tr_translation: "I might ask you this," replied Elizabeth, "why do you tell me that you love me against your will, your reason, and even your character, with such a clear sense of insult? If I have acted rudely, isn't that a sufficient reason to behave rudely? But I have other reasons as well. You know I do. Do you think I would accept the man who perhaps forever ruined the happiness of my dearest sister, for any reason, if my feelings towards you were not negative, if they were indifferent, or even if they were positive?"
es_translation: ––I could also ask, replied Elizabeth–– why, with such an evident purpose of offending and insulting me, you tell me that you like me against your will, against your better judgment, and even against your nature. Isn't this an excuse for my lack of courtesy, if indeed I have committed it? But, moreover, I have received other provocations, you know that very well. Even if my feelings had not been contrary to yours, even if they had been indifferent or even favorable, do you think there would be anything that could tempt me to accept the man who has been responsible for ruining, perhaps forever, the happiness of a very dear sister?

en: She paused, and saw with no slight indignation that he was listening with an air which proved him wholly unmoved by any feeling of remorse. He even looked at her with a smile of affected incredulity.
vi: Cô dừng lại và thấy, cùng với nỗi căm phẫn lúc đầu, anh đang lắng nghe với vẻ chứng tỏ anh không hề có ý ân hận. Anh lại còn nhìn cô với nụ cười biểu lộ vẻ hoài nghi trong xúc động.
tr: Sustu, zerre kadar vicdan azabı duymadığını gösteren bir havayla onu dinlediğini gördü, yine öfkelendi. Mr Darcy, aksine, yapmacık bir inanmazlık gülümsemesiyle bakıyordu ona.
es: Hizo una pausa y vio, indignada, que Darcy la estaba escuchando con un aire que indicaba no hallarse en absoluto conmovido por ningún tipo de remordimiento. Incluso la miraba con una sonrisa de petulante incredulidad.
vi_translation: She stopped and saw, along with the initial resentment, that he was listening with an expression that showed he had no intention of regretting. He even looked at her with a smile that expressed skepticism in his emotions.
tr_translation: She saw that he was listening with an air that showed he felt not the slightest bit of remorse, and she became angry again. Mr. Darcy, on the contrary, was looking at her with a smile of feigned disbelief.
es_translation: She paused and saw, indignantly, that Darcy was listening to her with an air that indicated he was not at all moved by any kind of remorse. He even looked at her with a smile of petulant disbelief.

en: “You have said quite enough, madam. I perfectly comprehend your feelings, and have now only to be ashamed of what my own have been. Forgive me for having taken up so much of your time, and accept my best wishes for your health and happiness.”
vi: - Cô đã nói đủ rồi. Tôi hoàn toàn hiểu những cảm nghĩ của cô, bây giờ tôi chỉ biết hổ thẹn cho những cảm nghĩ trước đây của tôi. Thứ lỗi cho tôi đã chiếm nhiều thời giờ của cô, và xin nhận những lời chúc tốt đẹp nhất cho sức khoẻ và hạnh phúc của cô.
tr: "Yeterince konuştunuz, madam. Duygularınızı gayet iyi anlıyorum; şimdi sadece kendi duygularımdan utanmak durumundayım. Bu kadar zamanınızı aldığım için beni bağışlayın ve sağlık ve mutluluk dileklerimi kabul edin.
es: ––Ha dicho usted bastante, señorita. Comprendo perfectamente sus sentimientos y sólo me resta avergonzarme de los míos. Perdone por haberle hecho perder tanto tiempo, y acepte mis buenos deseos de salud y felicidad.
vi_translation: - You have said enough. I completely understand your feelings, now I only feel ashamed of my previous thoughts. Forgive me for taking up so much of your time, and please accept my best wishes for your health and happiness.
tr_translation: "You have spoken enough, madam. I understand your feelings very well; now I must only be ashamed of my own feelings. Forgive me for taking up so much of your time and accept my wishes for health and happiness."
es_translation: ––You have said enough, miss. I perfectly understand your feelings and I can only be ashamed of my own. Forgive me for having made you waste so much time, and accept my best wishes for your health and happiness.

en: “Be not alarmed, madam, on receiving this letter, by the apprehension of its containing any repetition of those sentiments, or renewal of those offers, which were last night so disgusting to you. I write without any intention of paining you, or humbling myself, by dwelling on wishes, which, for the happiness of both, cannot be too soon forgotten; and the effort which the formation and the perusal of this letter must occasion, should have been spared, had not my character required it to be written and read. You must, therefore, pardon the freedom with which I demand your attention; your feelings, I know, will bestow it unwillingly, but I demand it of your justice.
vi: “Thưa cô, cô không nên hốt hoảng khi nhận thư này vì lo nó lập lại tâm tư kia hoặc cầu khẩn thêm lần nữa, mà tất cả đã khiến cô kinh tởm tối hôm qua. Tôi viết mà không có ý định muốn cô đau khổ, hoặc có ý nhún nhường về phần tôi bằng cách vương vấn với ước vọng không thể quên lãng quá sớm, ước vọng về hạnh phúc cho cả hai. Đáng lẽ không cần nỗ lực để viết và đọc thư này nếu không cần phải viết ra và đọc qua về cá tính của tôi. Vì thế, cô nên lượng thứ cho tôi đã tự tiện đòi hỏi sự chú ý của cô. Tôi biết tâm tư của cô sẽ chú ý một cách miễn cưỡng, nhưng tôi đòi hỏi sự chú ý do thái độ công bằng của cô.
tr: "Bu mektubu alınca, Madam, dün gece size öylesine itici gelen itirafları tekrar ettiğini ya da o teklifleri yenilediğini düşünerek ürkmeyin. Her ikimizin de mutluluğu için bir an önce unutulması gereken dilekler üzerinde durarak size acı çektirme, kendimi de küçük düşürme niyetiyle yazmıyorum; saygınlığım yazılmasını ve okunmasını gerektirmesiydi bu mektubun yazılması için de okunması için de yorulmaya değmezdi. Dolayısıyla, dikkatinizi talep etme cüretimi mazur görmelisiniz; biliyorum, duygularınız talebime isteksizce cevap verecek, ama bunu adalet duygunuza sığınarak talep ediyorum.
es: No se alarme, señorita, al recibir esta carta, ni crea que voy a repetir en ella mis sentimientos o a renovar las proposiciones que tanto le molestaron anoche. Escribo sin ninguna intención de afligirla ni de humillarme yo insistiendo en unos deseos que, para la felicidad de ambos, no pueden olvidarse tan fácilmente; el esfuerzo de redactar y de leer esta carta podía haber sido evitado si mi modo de ser no me obligase a escribirla y a que usted la lea. Por lo tanto, perdóneme que tome la libertad de solicitar su atención; aunque ya sé que habrá de concedérmela de mala gana, se lo pido en justicia.
vi_translation: “Dear Miss, you should not panic upon receiving this letter for fear that it reiterates the sentiments or pleads once more, all of which disgusted you last night. I write without the intention of causing you sorrow, nor with the intent of humbling myself by clinging to an unforgettably early desire, a desire for happiness for both of us. There would be no need to make the effort to write and read this letter if it were not necessary to express and understand my character. Therefore, you should forgive me for presumptuously demanding your attention. I know your sentiments will pay attention reluctantly, but I demand your attention due to your fair attitude.
tr_translation: "When you receive this letter, Madam, do not be alarmed thinking that he repeated the confessions that were so repulsive to you last night or renewed those proposals. I am not writing with the intention of causing you pain by dwelling on wishes that should be forgotten as soon as possible for the happiness of both of us, nor to demean myself; my respectability required that this letter be written and read, but it would not be worth the effort to write or read it. Therefore, you must excuse my audacity in seeking your attention; I know your feelings will reluctantly respond to my request, but I make this appeal relying on your sense of justice.
es_translation: Do not be alarmed, miss, upon receiving this letter, nor believe that I am going to repeat my feelings or renew the propositions that bothered you so much last night. I write with no intention of distressing you nor of humiliating myself by insisting on desires that, for the happiness of both, cannot be forgotten so easily; the effort of writing and reading this letter could have been avoided if my nature did not compel me to write it and you to read it. Therefore, forgive me for taking the liberty of requesting your attention; although I know you will grant it reluctantly, I ask for it in fairness.

en: “How despicably have I acted!” she cried. “I, who have prided myself on my discernment! I, who have valued myself on my abilities! who have often disdained the generous candour of my sister, and gratified my vanity in useless or blameless distrust. How humiliating is this discovery! Yet, how just a humiliation! Had I been in love, I could not have been more wretchedly blind. But vanity, not love, has been my folly. Pleased with the preference of one, and offended by the neglect of the other, on the very beginning of our acquaintance, I have courted prepossession and ignorance, and driven reason away where either were concerned. Till this moment, I never knew myself.”
vi: Cô thốt lên: “Mình đã hành động một cách quá ti tiện! Mình đã tự hào về nhận thức của mình! Mình đã tự đánh giá cao về khả năng của mình! Đã từng xem thường tính chân thật phóng khoáng của chị mình, làm thoả mãn tính phù phiếm trong cung cách ngờ vực vô ích hoặc đáng lên án. Thật nhục nhã làm sao khi đã hiểu ra! Mà đúng thế, chỉ có nhục nhã! Nếu mình biết yêu, mình đã không thể mù quáng một cách khốn khổ đến thế! Nhưng tính phù phiếm, không phải tình yêu, đã luôn là sự điên rồ của mình. Cảm động vì lòng ưu ái của một người và bị xúc phạm vì người kia thờ ơ, ngay từ khi bắt đầu mối giao hảo với anh, mình đã có đầy những định kiến, những ngu xuẩn, luôn xua đuổi mọi lý lẽ. Từ đầu cho đến lúc này, mình đã chẳng bao giờ nhận ra con người thật của mình.”
tr: "Ne rezilce davrandım!" diye haykırdı. –"Ben ki sezgilerimle gurur duyardım! –Ben ki yeteneklerimi beğenirdim! ablamın sınırsız iyiniyetini küçümser, ayıp ve anlamsız bir şüphecilik içinde kendime hayran olur dururdum. –Bunu farketmek ne kadar küçük düşürücü! –Nasıl da küçük düşürücü! –Aşık olsaydım bundan daha sefil bir körlük içinde olamazdım. Ama aptalca hatam aşk değil gurur oldu. Daha tanışır tanışmaz birinin tercihi olmaktan hoşlandım, öteki tarafından ihmal edildiğime gücendim; her ikisi hakkında da önyargılı ve cahilce davrandım, aklı bir kenara bıraktım. Meğer bu ana kadar kendimi tanımıyormuşum.
es: «¡De qué modo tan despreciable he obrado ––pensó––, yo que me enorgullecía de mi perspicacia! ¡Yo que me he vanagloriado de mi talento, que he desdeñado el generoso candor de mi hermana y he halagado mi vanidad con recelos inútiles o censurables! ¡Qué humillante es todo esto, pero cómo merezco esta humillación! Si hubiese estado enamorada de Wickham, no habría actuado con tan lamentable ceguera. Pero la vanidad, y no el amor, ha sido mi locura. Complacida con la preferencia del uno y ofendida con el desprecio del otro, me he entregado desde el principio a la presunción y a la ignorancia, huyendo de la razón en cuanto se trataba de cualquiera de los dos. Hasta este momento no me conocía a mí misma.»
vi_translation: She exclaimed: "I have acted in such a despicable manner! I have been proud of my own awareness! I have overestimated my own abilities! I have looked down on my sister's genuine and generous nature, satisfying my own vanity with useless or condemnable suspicion. How shameful it is to have realized this! Indeed, it is only shame! If I had known love, I could not have been so miserably blind! But vanity, not love, has always been my folly. Moved by one person's kindness and offended by another's indifference, from the very beginning of my acquaintance with him, I have been full of prejudices, foolishness, always rejecting all reason. From the start until now, I have never truly recognized my own self."
tr_translation: "I acted disgracefully!" he shouted. –"I, who used to take pride in my intuition! –I, who used to admire my talents! I would belittle my sister's boundless goodwill, and in a shameful and meaningless skepticism, I would constantly admire myself. –How humiliating it is to realize this! –How utterly humiliating! –If I had been in love, I couldn't have been in a more wretched blindness than this. But my foolish mistake was not love, it was pride. As soon as we met, I liked being someone's choice, and I was offended by being neglected by the other; I acted prejudiced and ignorantly about both, setting reason aside. It turns out I didn't know myself until this moment."
es_translation: “How despicably I have acted,” she thought, “I, who prided myself on my discernment!” “I, who have boasted of my talent, who have scorned my sister’s generous candor, and have flattered my vanity with useless or blameworthy suspicions!” “How humiliating all this is, but how I deserve this humiliation!” If I had been in love with Wickham, I would not have acted with such lamentable blindness. But vanity, not love, has been my folly. Pleased with the preference of one and offended by the disdain of the other, I have from the beginning given myself up to presumption and ignorance, avoiding reason whenever it concerned either of them. Until this moment, I did not know myself.”

en: After wandering along the lane for two hours, giving way to every variety of thought, reconsidering events, determining probabilities, and reconciling herself, as well as she could, to a change so sudden and so important, fatigue, and a recollection of her long absence, made her at length return home; and she entered the house with the wish of appearing cheerful as usual, and the resolution of repressing such reflections as must make her unfit for conversation.
vi: Sau khi đã thơ thẩn dọc con đường mòn trong hai giờ, buông thả theo mọi ý nghĩ, xem xét lại các sự kiện, xác định các điều khả dĩ, và cố tự dung hoà với biến động quá bất ngờ và quá trọng đại, sự mệt mỏi và ý nghĩ bất chợt rằng cô đã vắng mặt khá lâu khiến cô quay bước trở về. Cô bước vào ngôi nhà với mong muốn tỏ ra vui vẻ như thường lệ, và ý kiên quyết trấn áp những suy tư khiến cô thấy khó có thể trò chuyện với ai.
tr: İki saat boyunca patikada yürüdükten, her çeşit düşünceye kapıldıktan, olayları tekrar düşündükten, olasılıkları belirledikten ve öyle ani, öyle önemli bir değişiklikle elinden geldiğince uzlaştıktan sonra yorgunluk ve uzun yokluğunu farketmek onu eve yöneltti; eve her zamanki gibi neşeli görünme arzusuyla ve başkalarının yanında suskunlaşmasına neden olabilecek düşünceleri bastırma kararıyla girdi.
es: Después de andar dos horas a lo largo del camino dando vueltas a la diversidad de sus pensamientos, considerando de nuevo los hechos, determinando posibilidades y haciéndose paulatinamente a tan repentino e importante cambio, la fatiga y el acordarse del tiempo que hacía que estaba fuera la hicieron regresar a la casa. Entró en ella con el propósito de aparentar su alegría de siempre y resuelta a reprimir los pensamientos que la asediaban, ya que de otra forma no sería capaz de mantener conversación alguna.
vi_translation: After wandering along the path for two hours, indulging in every thought, reviewing events, determining possibilities, and trying to reconcile herself with the sudden and significant upheaval, fatigue and the sudden realization that she had been absent for quite a while made her turn back. She entered the house with the desire to appear cheerful as usual, and the firm intention to suppress the thoughts that made it difficult for her to converse with anyone.
tr_translation: After walking on the path for two hours, getting caught up in all sorts of thoughts, reconsidering events, determining possibilities, and reconciling as best as he could with such a sudden and significant change, the fatigue and his long absence made him head home; he entered the house with the desire to appear cheerful as usual and with the decision to suppress thoughts that might cause him to become silent in the presence of others.
es_translation: After walking for two hours along the road, turning over the diversity of her thoughts, reconsidering the events, determining possibilities, and gradually getting used to such a sudden and significant change, fatigue and the memory of how long she had been away made her return to the house. She entered with the intention of feigning her usual cheerfulness and resolved to suppress the thoughts that besieged her, as otherwise, she would not be able to maintain any conversation.

en: When to these recollections was added the development of Wickham’s character, it may be easily believed that the happy spirits which had seldom been depressed before were now so much affected as to make it almost impossible for her to appear tolerably cheerful.
vi: Khi con người thật của Wickham được thêm vào hồi tưởng này, những ý tình hạnh phúc lúc trước ít khi bị đè nén nay bị ảnh hưởng nặng nề đến nỗi cô hầu như không thể cố làm ra vẻ vui tươi dù tương đối.
tr: Bu düşüncelere Wickham'ın karakterinin ortaya çıkması da eklenince, daha önce nadiren kararan mutlu ruh halinin şimdi bir ölçüde neşeli görünmesini bile onun için imkânsız kıldığına kolayca inanılabilir.
es: Cuando a todo esto se añadía el descubrimiento de la verdadera personalidad de Wickham, se comprendía fácilmente que el espíritu jovial de Elizabeth, que raras veces se había sentido deprimido, hubiese decaído ahora de tal modo que casi se le hacía imposible aparentar un poco de alegría.
vi_translation: When Wickham's true nature was added to this recollection, the previously seldom suppressed happy sentiments were now so heavily affected that she could hardly even pretend to be relatively cheerful.
tr_translation: When the emergence of Wickham's character was added to these thoughts, it can easily be believed that it made it impossible for her to appear even somewhat cheerful, whereas she had previously rarely been in a dark mood.
es_translation: When to all this was added the discovery of Wickham's true personality, it was easily understood that Elizabeth's jovial spirit, which had rarely felt depressed, had now declined to such an extent that it was almost impossible for her to feign even a little joy.

en: As soon as all had ate, and the elder ones paid, the carriage was ordered; and, after some contrivance, the whole party, with all their boxes, workbags, and parcels, and the unwelcome addition of Kitty’s and Lydia’s purchases, were seated in it.
vi: Sau khi họ đã ăn xong và các cô chị đã trả tiền, họ gọi người đánh xe và chất lên mọi hành lý, thùng hộp, túi gói, cùng mấy món hàng Kitty và Lydia đã mua mà không ai thích.
tr: Herkes yemeğini yeyip de ablalar hesabı ödedikten sonra araba emredildi; biraz uğraştıktan sonra hepsi birden, bütün kutuları, elişi torbaları ve paketleri ve Kitty'yle Lydia'nın alışverişlerinin can sıkıcı ilavesiyle arabaya yerleştiler.
es: En cuanto hubieron comido y las mayores hubieron pagado, pidieron el coche y, después de organizarse un poco, todas las muchachas, con sus cajas, sus bolsas de labor, sus paquetes y la mal acogida adición de las compras de Catherine y Lydia, se acomodaron en el vehículo.
vi_translation: After they had finished eating and the older sisters had paid, they called the driver and loaded all the luggage, boxes, bags, along with the items Kitty and Lydia had bought that no one liked.
tr_translation: After everyone finished their meal and the sisters paid the bill, the car was summoned; after a bit of effort, they all settled into the car along with all the boxes, craft bags, and packages, and the annoying addition of Kitty and Lydia's shopping.
es_translation: As soon as they had eaten and the older ones had paid, they called for the carriage and, after organizing themselves a bit, all the girls, with their boxes, their work bags, their packages, and the poorly received addition of Catherine and Lydia's purchases, settled into the vehicle.

en: “You are quite right. To have his errors made public might ruin him for ever. He is now, perhaps, sorry for what he has done, and anxious to re-establish a character. We must not make him desperate.”
vi: - Em nghĩ đúng lắm. Nếu vạch trần mọi lỗi lầm của anh ấy, ta có thể huỷ hoại cả cuộc đời anh. Có lẽ giờ anh ấy đang hối tiếc về những gì anh đã làm, muốn tạo dựng lại con người mình. Chúng ta không nên làm anh tuyệt vọng.
tr: "Çok haklısın. Kusurlarını açıklamak hayatını karartabilir. Belki şimdi yaptıkları için pişmandır ve yeniden adam olmaya çalışıyordur. Umutlarını yıkmayalım.
es: ––Me parece muy bien. Si propagases sus defectos podrías arruinarle para siempre. A lo mejor se arrepiente de lo que hizo y quiere enmendarse. No debemos empujarle a la desesperación.
vi_translation: - I think you're absolutely right. If we expose all his mistakes, we could ruin his entire life. Maybe now he's regretting what he did and wants to rebuild himself. We shouldn't make him lose hope.
tr_translation: "You are absolutely right. Revealing his flaws could ruin his life. Maybe he regrets what he has done and is trying to become a better person again. Let's not crush his hopes."
es_translation: ––It seems very good to me. If you spread his defects, you could ruin him forever. Maybe he regrets what he did and wants to make amends. We should not push him to despair.

en: “No; it would have been strange if they had. But I make no doubt they often talk of it between themselves. Well, if they can be easy with an estate that is not lawfully their own, so much the better. I should be ashamed of having one that was only entailed on me.”
vi: - Đúng vậy. Nếu họ nói thì quả là kỳ lạ. Nhưng mẹ không nghi ngờ gì nữa. Họ thường nói đến chuyện ấy với nhau. À, nếu họ có thể thấy thoải mái với một sự sản không phải là của họ theo pháp luật, thì cũng tốt thôi. Mẹ hẳn sẽ xấu hổ khi có được một sự sản mà mẹ chỉ thừa kế theo thứ tự.
tr: "Öyle. Konuşsalar tuhaf olurdu. Ama hiç kuşkum yok, kendi aralarında sık sık bunu konuşuyorlar. Eh, kanunen kendilerine ait olmayan bir eve konunca içleri rahat edecekse, kendileri bilirler. Öyle miras bana kalacak olsa ben o mirasa konmaya utanırdım.
es: ––Claro, no habría estado bien; pero no me cabe la menor duda de que lo hablan muchas veces entre ellos. Bueno, si se contentan con una posesión que legalmente no es suya, allá ellos. A mí me avergonzaría.
vi_translation: - That's right. If they say so, it is indeed strange. But I no longer have any doubts. They often talk about that with each other. Well, if they can feel comfortable with a property that is not legally theirs, then that's fine. I would be ashamed to have a property that I only inherited by order.
tr_translation: "Indeed. It would be strange if they talked. But I have no doubt, they often talk about this among themselves. Well, if they will feel at ease by settling in a house that doesn't legally belong to them, it's their choice. If such an inheritance were to come to me, I would be ashamed to claim it."
es_translation: ––Of course, it wouldn't have been appropriate; but I have no doubt that they talk about it many times among themselves. Well, if they are content with a possession that legally isn't theirs, that's their problem. It would embarrass me.

en: “When I said that he improved on acquaintance, I did not mean that either his mind or manners were in a state of improvement; but that, from knowing him better, his disposition was better understood.”
vi: - Khi tôi nói anh ấy đã giao tiếp tốt hơn, tôi không có ý nói hoặc tâm thức hoặc cử chỉ của anh ấy tốt hơn lên. Tôi chỉ muốn nói, nếu đã biết về anh ấy thêm, ta có thể hiểu anh ấy nhiều hơn.
tr: "Tanıdıkça hoşlaşıyor derken düşünce ya da davranışlarının hoş bir değişiklik geçirdiğini değil, onu daha iyi tanıdıkça mizacının daha iyi anlaşıldığını kastettim.
es: ––Al decir que gana con el trato, no quiero dar a entender que su modo de ser o sus maneras hayan mejorado, sino que al conocerle mejor, más fácilmente se comprende su actitud.
vi_translation: - When I said he communicated better, I didn't mean that his speech or gestures had improved. I just meant that, if we knew more about him, we could understand him better.
tr_translation: "When I said 'he becomes more pleasant as you get to know him,' I didn't mean that his thoughts or behaviors undergo a pleasant change, but rather that as you get to know him better, his temperament is better understood."
es_translation: ––By saying that he benefits from the interaction, I do not mean to imply that his character or manners have improved, but rather that by getting to know him better, it is easier to understand his attitude.

en: “But it is fortunate,” thought she, “that I have something to wish for. Were the whole arrangement complete, my disappointment would be certain. But here, by carrying with me one ceaseless source of regret in my sister’s absence, I may reasonably hope to have all my expectations of pleasure realized. A scheme of which every part promises delight can never be successful; and general disappointment is only warded off by the defence of some little peculiar vexation.”
vi: Cô nghĩ: “May là mình còn có điều gì đấy để ước mong. Nếu việc dàn xếp đã đầy đủ, mình chắc chắn sẽ bị thất vọng. Nhưng ở đây, bằng cách mang trong tâm tư một nguồn tiếc nuối bất tận trong khi cô em vắng mặt, mình có thể hy vọng mọi mong ước sẽ trở thành hiện thực. Một kế hoạch trong đó mọi việc đều hứa hẹn mang đến niềm vui thì không khi nào thành công, chỉ có thể tránh thất vọng qua việc bào chữa cho một ít phiền toái kỳ dị.”
tr: "Ama neyse ki," diye düşündü, "dileyecek bir şeyim var. Tüm ayarlamalar yapılmış olsaydı hayal kırıklığına uğrayacağım kesin olurdu. Ama burada, ablam yokken yanımda kesintisiz bir üzüntü kaynağı taşıyarak tüm sevinç beklentilerimin gerçekleşmesini umut edebilirim. Her parçası keyif vaat eden bir plan asla başarılı olamaz; büyük bir hayal kırıklığını önlemenin tek yolu ufak bir sıkıntıyı savunmaktır.
es: ––«Es una suerte ––pensaba–– tener algo que desear. Si todo fuese completo, algo habría, sin falta, que me decepcionase. Pero ahora, llevándome esa fuente de añoranza que será la ausencia de Jane, puedo pensar razonablemente que todas mis expectativas de placer se verán colmadas. Un proyecto que en todas sus partes promete dichas, nunca sale bien; y no te puedes librar de algún contratiempo, si no tienes una pequeña contrariedad.»
vi_translation: She thought: "It's fortunate that I still have something to wish for. If everything had been arranged perfectly, I would surely be disappointed. But here, by harboring an endless source of regret while my sister is absent, I can hope that all my wishes will come true. A plan in which everything promises to bring joy never succeeds; one can only avoid disappointment by making excuses for a few peculiar inconveniences."
tr_translation: "But luckily," she thought, "I have something to wish for. If all the arrangements had been made, I would certainly be disappointed. But here, while my sister is not around, I can carry a continuous source of sorrow with me and hope for all my joy expectations to come true. A plan that promises pleasure in every part can never succeed; the only way to prevent a great disappointment is to defend a small inconvenience."
es_translation: ––"It's a stroke of luck," he thought, "to have something to desire. If everything were complete, there would undoubtedly be something that would disappoint me. But now, carrying with me that source of longing which will be Jane's absence, I can reasonably think that all my expectations of pleasure will be fulfilled. A plan that in all its parts promises happiness never turns out well; and you can't avoid some mishap if you don't have a small setback."

en: “And of this place,” thought she, “I might have been mistress! With these rooms I might have now been familiarly acquainted! Instead of viewing them as a stranger, I might have rejoiced in them as my own, and welcomed to them as visitors my uncle and aunt. But, no,” recollecting herself, “that could never be; my uncle and aunt would have been lost to me; I should not have been allowed to invite them.”
vi: Cô nghĩ: “Mình có thể là bà chủ nơi này! Bây giờ mình có thể bắt đầu làm quen với các gian phòng này. Thay vì ngắm nghía mọi thứ như là khách lạ, mình có thể sướng thoả xem như là thuộc về mình, có thể tiếp đón cậu mợ như là hai người thân đến thăm”. Cô trấn tĩnh lại: “Nhưng không được, không bao giờ như thế; cậu mợ sẽ không biết chuyện gì xảy ra với mình; không nên mời họ đến”.
tr: "Ve ben," diye düşündü, "bu yerin hanımı olabilirdim! Bu odaları şimdi gayet yakından tanıyor olabilirdim! Bunlara yabancı gibi bakmak yerine bana aitler diye keyiflenebilir, dayımla yengemi misafir olarak buyur edebilirdim. –Ama hayır," –kendini toparladı, – "öyle olmaz: dayımla yengemi kaybederdim: onları davet etmeme izin verilmezdi.
es: «¡Y pensar ––se decía–– que habría podido ser dueña de todo esto! ¡Estas habitaciones podrían ahora ser las mías! ¡En lugar de visitarlas como una forastera, podría disfrutarlas y recibir en ellas la visita de mis tíos! Pero no ––repuso recobrándose––, no habría sido posible, hubiese tenido que renunciar a mis tíos; no se me hubiese permitido invitarlos.»
vi_translation: She thought: "I could be the mistress of this place! Now I can start getting familiar with these rooms. Instead of looking at everything like a stranger, I can delight in seeing it as mine, and I can welcome my uncle and aunt as if they were two close relatives visiting." She calmed herself: "But no, it can never be like that; my uncle and aunt will never know what happened to me; I shouldn't invite them."
tr_translation: "And I," she thought, "could have been the mistress of this place! I could have known these rooms very well by now! Instead of looking at them as a stranger, I could have enjoyed them as mine and could have invited my uncle and aunt as guests. –But no," –she pulled herself together, – "it wouldn't be like that: I would have lost my uncle and aunt: I wouldn't have been allowed to invite them."
es_translation: "And to think," she said to herself, "that I could have been the mistress of all this! These rooms could now be mine! Instead of visiting them as a stranger, I could enjoy them and receive my uncles here! But no," she replied, recovering herself, "it would not have been possible, I would have had to give up my uncles; I would not have been allowed to invite them."

en: “I am sure I know none so handsome; but in the gallery upstairs you will see a finer, larger picture of him than this. This room was my late master’s favourite room, and these miniatures are just as they used to be then. He was very fond of them.”
vi: - Tôi chắc chắn tôi chưa từng thấy ai đẹp trai đến thế, nhưng trong phòng trên lầu cô sẽ thấy một bức hoạ đẹp hơn, lớn hơn bức này. Gian phòng này là nơi ông cụ ưa thích nhất; những bức tiểu hoạ này vẫn được sắp đặt y như ngày xưa. Ông cụ rất thích các bức họa này.
tr: "Bu kadar yakışıklı birini görmediğime eminim; ama üst kattaki galeride bundan daha büyük, daha güzel bir resmini göreceksiniz. Bu oda rahmetli efendimin en sevdiği odaydı; bu minyatürler de aynı onun bıraktığı gibi duruyor. Bunlara çok düşkündü.
es: ––Juraría que es el más guapo que he visto; pero en la galería del piso de arriba verán ustedes un retrato suyo mejor y más grande. Este cuarto era el favorito de mi anterior señor, y estas miniaturas están tal y como estaban en vida suya. Le gustaban mucho.
vi_translation: - I am sure I have never seen anyone as handsome, but in the room upstairs you will see a more beautiful painting, larger than this one. This room was the old man's favorite; these miniature paintings are still arranged just as they were in the old days. The old man was very fond of these paintings.
tr_translation: "I am sure I have never seen someone so handsome; but in the gallery upstairs, you will see a bigger and more beautiful portrait of him. This room was my late master's favorite room; these miniatures are exactly as he left them. He was very fond of them."
es_translation: ––I would swear he is the most handsome I have seen; but in the gallery upstairs you will see a better and larger portrait of him. This room was the favorite of my previous master, and these miniatures are just as they were during his lifetime. He liked them very much.

en: “Oh, yes—the handsomest young lady that ever was seen; and so accomplished! She plays and sings all day long. In the next room is a new instrument just come down for her—a present from my master: she comes here to-morrow with him.”
vi: - À! Vâng – một tiểu thư trẻ đẹp chưa từng thấy, mà lại có nhiều tài năng nữa. Cô ấy ca diễn suốt ngày. Trong phòng kế bên có đặt một chiếc đàn mới vừa được giao đến cho cô – quà tặng của ông chủ tôi; cô sẽ đến đây cùng với ông ấy.
tr: "A evet –gelmiş geçmiş en güzel genç hanım; öyle de hünerli ki! –Bütün gün çalıp söylüyor. Yandaki odada onun için henüz gelen yeni bir piyano var –efendimin hediyesi; yarın onunla küçük hanım da geliyor.
es: ––¡Oh, sí! ¡Es la joven más bella que se haya visto jamás! ¡Y tan aplicada! Toca y canta todo el día. En la siguiente habitación hay un piano nuevo que le acaban de traer, regalo de mi señor. Ella también llegará mañana con él.
vi_translation: - Ah! Yes – a young lady, beautiful beyond compare, and very talented too. She sings and performs all day long. In the next room, there is a new piano that was just delivered for her – a gift from my master; she will come here with him.
tr_translation: "Ah yes – the most beautiful young lady ever; and so talented too! –She plays and sings all day long. There is a new piano that just arrived for her in the next room – a gift from my master; the young lady is coming with it tomorrow."
es_translation: ––Oh, yes! She is the most beautiful young woman ever seen! And so diligent! She plays and sings all day long. In the next room, there is a new piano that was just brought to her, a gift from my master. She will also arrive tomorrow with him.

en: This was praise of all others most extraordinary, most opposite to her ideas. That he was not a good-tempered man had been her firmest opinion. Her keenest attention was awakened: she longed to hear more; and was grateful to her uncle for saying,—
vi: Đây là lời ca ngợi khác thường so với những lời ca ngợi khác, hoàn toàn trái ngược với ý kiến của cô. Cô luôn tin chắc rằng anh không phải là người điềm đạm. Sự chú ý của cô càng trỗi dậy thêm, và cô thích thú được nghe ông cậu nói:
tr: Bu övgü tümünün en olağandışı, Elizabeth'in düşüncelerine en aykırı olanıydı. Onun sevimli bir adam olmadığına kesinlikle inanıyordu. Tüm dikkati canlandı; daha fazla duymak istedi ve dayısının sözlerini duyunca ona karşı minnettarlık duydu,
es: Era un elogio más importante que todos los otros y más opuesto a lo que Elizabeth pensaba de Darcy. Siempre creyó firmemente que era hombre de mal carácter. Con viva curiosidad esperaba seguir oyendo lo que decía el ama, cuando su tío observó:
vi_translation: This is an unusual praise compared to other praises, completely contrary to her opinion. She always firmly believed that he was not a calm person. Her attention was further aroused, and she was delighted to hear her uncle say:
tr_translation: This praise was the most unusual of all, the one most contrary to Elizabeth's thoughts. She was absolutely convinced that he was not a charming man. All her attention was aroused; she wanted to hear more and felt grateful to her uncle when she heard his words,
es_translation: It was a more important compliment than all the others and more opposed to what Elizabeth thought of Darcy. She always firmly believed that he was a man of bad character. With keen curiosity, she waited to keep hearing what the housekeeper was saying, when her uncle observed:

en: “Yes, sir, I know I am. If I were to go through the world, I could not meet with a better. But I have always observed, that they who are good-natured when children, are good-natured when they grow up; and he was always the sweetest tempered, most generous-hearted boy in the world.”
vi: - Vâng, thưa Ngài, tôi biết tôi may mắn. Nếu tôi đi khắp thế giới, tôi sẽ không thể gặp người nào hơn ông ấy. Nhưng tôi luôn thấy một điều là người có tính tốt khi còn nhỏ sẽ có tính tốt khi lớn lên; và ông ấy luôn là đứa trẻ hiền dịu nhất, có con tim rộng lượng nhất trên thế giới.
tr: "Evet, beyfendi, şanslı olduğumu biliyorum. Dünyayı dolaşsam daha iyisine rastlayamam. Ama her zaman görmüşümdür, çocukken iyi huylu olanlar büyüyünce de iyi huylu olurlar; o da dünyanın en tatlı huylu, en yumuşak kalpli çocuğuydu.
es: ––Sí, señor; es una suerte. Aunque diese la vuelta al mundo, no encontraría otro mejor. Siempre me he fijado en que los que son bondadosos de pequeños, siguen siéndolo de mayores. Y el señor Darcy era el niño más dulce y generoso de la tierra.
vi_translation: - Yes, Sir, I know I am lucky. If I traveled around the world, I would not be able to meet anyone better than him. But I always see one thing: a person who has a good nature as a child will have a good nature when they grow up; and he has always been the gentlest child, with the most generous heart in the world.
tr_translation: "Yes, sir, I know that I am lucky. I couldn't find a better one even if I traveled the world. But I have always seen that those who are well-behaved as children remain well-behaved when they grow up; and he was the sweetest-natured, most soft-hearted child in the world."
es_translation: ––Yes, sir; it is a stroke of luck. Even if you traveled around the world, you wouldn't find a better one. I've always noticed that those who are kind as children, remain so as adults. And Mr. Darcy was the sweetest and most generous child on earth.

en: “He is the best landlord, and the best master,” said she, “that ever lived. Not like the wild young men now-a-days, who think of nothing but themselves. There is not one of his tenants or servants but what will give him a good name. Some people call him proud; but I am sure I never saw anything of it. To my fancy, it is only because he does not rattle away like other young men.”
vi: Bà nói: - Ông ấy là một địa chủ tốt nhất và là một gia chủ tốt nhất, không giống như mấy anh trai trẻ thời nay chỉ nghĩ đến mình mà không màng đến ai khác. Không có tá điền hay gia nhân nào không nói tốt về ông. Vài người nói ông có tính kiêu hãnh, nhưng tôi chưa từng thấy như thế. Tôi nghĩ đấy chỉ là vì ông không ba hoa như mấy anh trai trẻ.
tr: "Gelmiş geçmiş," dedi, "en iyi toprak ağası ve en iyi efendidir. Kendilerinden başka bir şey düşünmeyen bugünkü yabani delikanlılara benzemez. Onu iyi anmayacak tek bir kiracısı ya da hizmetçisi yoktur. Bazıları ona gururlu derler, ama ben zerresini görmediğime eminim. Bana kalırsa, diğer delikanlılar gibi şamata yapmadığı için öyle diyorlar.
es: ––Es el mejor señor y el mejor amo que pueda haber; no se parece a los atolondrados jóvenes de hoy en día que no piensen más que en sí mismos. No hay uno solo de sus colonos y criados que no le alabe. Algunos dicen que es orgulloso, pero yo nunca se lo he notado. Me figuro que lo encuentran orgulloso porque no es bullanguero como los demás.
vi_translation: She said: - He is the best landlord and the best householder, unlike the young men these days who only think of themselves and don't care about anyone else. There isn't a tenant or servant who doesn't speak well of him. Some people say he is proud, but I have never seen that. I think it's just because he doesn't boast like the young men.
tr_translation: "Of all time," he said, "he is the best landlord and the best master. He is unlike today's wild young men who think of nothing but themselves. There is not a single tenant or servant who would not speak well of him. Some call him proud, but I am sure I have not seen a trace of it. In my opinion, they say so because he does not make a fuss like other young men."
es_translation: ––He is the best lord and the best master that could exist; he is not like the reckless young men of today who think only of themselves. There is not a single one of his tenants and servants who does not praise him. Some say he is proud, but I have never noticed it. I suppose they find him proud because he is not boisterous like the others.

en: When all of the house that was open to general inspection had been seen, they returned down stairs; and, taking leave of the housekeeper, were consigned over to the gardener, who met them at the hall door.
vi: Sau khi đã đi xem qua mọi nơi được cho phép tham quan, ba người trở xuống tầng dưới, từ giã bà quản gia, được giới thiệu với người làm vườn đã đến tiền sảnh để gặp họ.
tr: Evin ziyarete açık her yeri görülünce alt kata döndüler; kahyaya veda ettiler ve hol kapısında onları bahçıvan devraldı.
es: Ya habían visto todo lo que mostraba al público de la casa; bajaron y se despidieron del ama de llaves, quien les confió a un jardinero que esperaba en la puerta del vestíbulo.
vi_translation: After having toured all the places they were allowed to visit, the three of them went back downstairs, bid farewell to the housekeeper, and were introduced to the gardener who had come to the foyer to meet them.
tr_translation: After they had seen every part of the house that was open to visitors, they went back downstairs; they bid farewell to the steward, and at the hall door, the gardener took over from him.
es_translation: They had already seen everything that was shown to the public in the house; they went downstairs and said goodbye to the housekeeper, who entrusted them to a gardener waiting at the vestibule door.

en: “But perhaps he may be a little whimsical in his civilities,” replied her uncle. “Your great men often are; and therefore I shall not take him at his word about fishing, as he might change his mind another day, and warn me off his grounds.”
vi: Ông cậu trả lời: - Nhưng có lẽ anh ấy có tính hơi thất thường trong phép lịch sự. Mấy người bạn của cháu đều như thế, nên cậu sẽ không thật lòng tin lời anh mời đến câu cá, vì một ngày nào đấy anh ta có thể đổi ý và cấm cậu bén mảng đến.
tr: "Ama belki kibarlığı bir parça raslantı olabilir," diye cevap verdi dayısı. "Büyük adamlar öyle olurlar; o yüzden balık tutma konusundaki sözlerini ciddiye almayacağım, çünkü yarın öbür gün dediğini unutup beni kovabilir.
es: ––Puede que sea un poco caprichoso en su cortesía ––replicó el tío––; esos señores tan encopetados suelen ser así. Por eso no le tomaré la palabra en lo referente a la pesca, no vaya a ser que otro día cambie de parecer y me eche de la finca.
vi_translation: Uncle answered: - But perhaps he has a somewhat erratic nature when it comes to politeness. All of your friends are like that, so you wouldn't truly believe his invitation to go fishing, because one day he might change his mind and forbid you from coming near.
tr_translation: "But maybe his politeness is a bit of a coincidence," his uncle replied. "Great men are like that; so I won't take his words about fishing seriously, because he might forget what he said and fire me the day after tomorrow."
es_translation: ––He might be a bit whimsical in his courtesy ––replied the uncle––; those very haughty gentlemen tend to be like that. That's why I won't take his word regarding the fishing, in case he changes his mind another day and throws me off the estate.

en: She retreated from the window, fearful of being seen; and as she walked up and down the room, endeavouring to compose herself, saw such looks of inquiring surprise in her uncle and aunt as made everything worse.
vi: Cô bước xa khỏi khung cửa sổ, ngại bị nhìn thấy; và khi cô bước qua lại trong căn phòng để cố gắng giữ trấn tĩnh, cô nhìn thấy tia mắt ngạc nhiên của ông cậu và bà mợ, khiến cô lại thêm bấn loạn.
tr: Pencereden çekildi, görünmekten korkup; kendini toparlamaya çalışarak odada telaşla yürürken dayısıyla yengesinin sorularla dolu şaşkın bakışlarını gördü ve işi daha da zorlaştı.
es: Se retiró de la ventana por temor a que la viesen, y, mientras paseaba de un lado a otro de la habitación, las miradas interrogantes de sus tíos la ponían aún más nerviosa.
vi_translation: She stepped away from the window, afraid of being seen; and as she paced back and forth in the room trying to stay calm, she saw the surprised looks of her uncle and aunt, which made her even more agitated.
tr_translation: He pulled back from the window, afraid of being seen; while trying to compose himself, he saw the bewildered looks filled with questions from his uncle and aunt, and his task became even more difficult.
es_translation: She withdrew from the window for fear of being seen, and, while pacing back and forth in the room, the questioning looks from her uncles made her even more nervous.

en: On reaching the house, they were shown through the hall into the saloon, whose northern aspect rendered it delightful for summer. Its windows, opening to the ground, admitted a most refreshing view of the high woody hills behind the house, and of the beautiful oaks and Spanish chestnuts which were scattered over the intermediate lawn.
vi: Khi đến ngôi biệt thự, hai người được dẫn qua tiền sảnh để đi vào đại sảnh, mở ra hướng bắc trông thật đẹp vào mùa hè. Các cửa sổ mở đến tận mặt đất, cho thấy quang cảnh thật tươi mát của những ngọn đồi phủ rừng cây phía sau ngôi biệt thự, của những cây sồi và dẻ rải rác trên thảm cỏ kế cận.
tr: Eve ulaşınca holden salona alındılar; kuzeye bakan cephesi salonu yaz için keyifli bir yer haline getiriyordu. Bahçeye açılan pencereleri evin arkasındaki yüksek ağaçlı tepelerin ve hemen öndeki çimenlikte yükselen harikulade meşe ve kestane ağaçlarının içaçıcı manzarasını gösteriyordu.
es: Al llegar a la casa atravesaron el vestíbulo y entraron en el salón cuya orientación al norte lo hacía delicioso en verano. Las ventanas abiertas de par en par brindaban una vista refrigerante de las altas colinas pobladas de bosque que estaban detrás del edificio, y de los hermosos robles y castaños de España dispersados por la pradera que se extendía delante de la casa.
vi_translation: When they arrived at the mansion, the two were led through the foyer to enter the great hall, which opened to the north and looked beautiful in the summer. The windows extended to the ground, revealing a refreshing view of the forest-covered hills behind the mansion, with oaks and chestnuts scattered across the adjacent lawn.
tr_translation: When they arrived at the house, they were taken from the hall to the living room; its north-facing aspect made the living room a pleasant place for summer. The windows opening to the garden displayed the refreshing view of the high wooded hills behind the house and the magnificent oak and chestnut trees rising in the grassy area just in front.
es_translation: Upon arriving at the house, they crossed the vestibule and entered the living room, whose northward orientation made it delightful in summer. The wide-open windows offered a refreshing view of the tall, forested hills behind the building, and of the beautiful oaks and chestnut trees of Spain scattered across the meadow that stretched out in front of the house.

en: “When my eyes were opened to his real character, oh! had I known what I ought, what I dared to do! But I knew not—I was afraid of doing too much. Wretched, wretched mistake!”
vi: - Khi tôi đã mở mắt nhận ra con người thật của anh ta… Ôi! Ước gì tôi đã biết tôi phải làm gì, dám làm gì! Nhưng tôi không biết… tôi ngại mình hành động quá căng. Khổ, khổ quá, lỗi của tôi!
tr: "Onun gerçek yüzünü gördüğüm zaman. –Ah! Ne yapmam gerektiğini, neye cesaret edebileceğimi bilseydim! Bilmiyordum –İleri gitmekten korktum. Ne sefilce hata yaptım!
es: ––¡Oh, si cuando abrí los ojos y vi quién era Wickham hubiese hecho lo que debía! Pero no me atreví, temí excederme. ¡Qué desdichado error!
vi_translation: - When I opened my eyes and realized his true nature... Oh! I wish I had known what to do, dared to do! But I didn't know... I was afraid of acting too harshly. Oh, the misery, it's all my fault!
tr_translation: "When I saw his true face. –Ah! If only I knew what I should do, what I could dare! I didn't know –I was afraid to move forward. What a miserable mistake I made!"
es_translation: ––Oh, if only when I opened my eyes and saw who Wickham was, I had done what I should have! But I didn't dare, I feared I would go too far. What an unfortunate mistake!

en: “I am afraid you have been long desiring my absence, nor have I anything to plead in excuse of my stay, but real, though unavailing concern. Would to Heaven that anything could be either said or done on my part, that might offer consolation to such distress! But I will not torment you with vain wishes, which may seem purposely to ask for your thanks. This unfortunate affair will, I fear, prevent my sister’s having the pleasure of seeing you at Pemberley to-day.”
vi: - Tôi e cô không muốn có tôi hiện diện ở đây, còn tôi cũng không có gì để xin ở lại ngoại trừ mối quan ngại chân tình, nhưng không giúp ích gì. Ước mong phần tôi có thể nói hoặc làm một việc gì đấy hầu giúp an ủi cô. Nhưng tôi không muốn phiền nhiễu cô với những hi vọng hão huyền mà dường như nói ra chỉ mong cô cảm ơn. Tôi e với chuyện không may này, em gái tôi không thể có hân hạnh tiếp đón cô ở Pemberley hôm nay.
tr: Lydia'nın bütün ailesini utanç ve rezalet içinde bırakması az sonra onun kişisel endişelerini sildi bitirdi; Elizabeth yüzünü mendiliyle örttü ve çok geçmeden başka herşeyi unuttu; birkaç dakikalık bir sessizlikten sonra arkadaşının sesiyle yeniden aklı o ana döndü, şöyle diyen sevecen ama ölçülü sesiyle: "Korkarım bir süredir burada bulunmamamı istemektesiniz; benim de gerçek ama faydasız endişem dışında kalışım için gösterecek bir mazaretim yok. Keşke yapabileceğim, söyleyebileceğim, sıkıntınızı azaltacak bir şey olsaydı. –Ama teşekkür etmenizi bekliyormuş gibi görünecek boş dileklerle sizi bunaltmayacağım. Bu talihsiz mesele, korkarım, kızkardeşimin bugün sizi Pemberley'de görme zevkinden yoksun kalmasına neden olacak.
es: ––Me temo que desea que me vaya, y no hay nada que disculpe mi presencia; pero me ha movido un verdadero aunque inútil interés. ¡Ojalá pudiese decirle o hacer algo que la consolase en semejante desgracia! Pero no quiero atormentarla con vanos deseos que parecerían formulados sólo para que me diese usted las gracias. Creo que este desdichado asunto va a privar a mi hermana del gusto de verla a usted hoy en Pemberley.
vi_translation: - I fear you do not want my presence here, and I have nothing to ask to stay except for sincere concern, but it is of no help. I wish I could say or do something to help comfort you. But I do not want to trouble you with vain hopes that seem to be spoken only to seek your thanks. I fear with this unfortunate matter, my sister cannot have the honor of receiving you at Pemberley today.
tr_translation: The disgrace and shame that Lydia brought upon her entire family soon erased her personal worries; Elizabeth covered her face with a handkerchief and soon forgot everything else; after a few minutes of silence, her friend's voice brought her back to the present moment, with a kind but measured tone saying: "I fear you have wanted me to leave for some time now; I have no excuse for my continued presence here other than my genuine but futile concern. I wish there was something I could do or say to alleviate your distress. –But I will not burden you with empty wishes that might seem like I am expecting your gratitude. This unfortunate matter, I fear, will deprive my sister of the pleasure of seeing you at Pemberley today."
es_translation: ––I am afraid you want me to leave, and there is nothing that excuses my presence; but I have been moved by a genuine, though useless, interest. I wish I could say or do something to console you in such misfortune! But I do not want to torment you with vain wishes that would seem to be expressed only so that you would thank me. I believe this unfortunate matter is going to deprive my sister of the pleasure of seeing you today at Pemberley.

en: He readily assured her of his secrecy, again expressed his sorrow for her distress, wished it a happier conclusion than there was at present reason to hope, and, leaving his compliments for her relations, with only one serious parting look, went away.
vi: Anh sốt sắng hứa với cô anh sẽ giữ kín. Rồi anh tỏ lòng thương cảm cho nỗi buồn khổ của cô, anh mong sẽ có một kết cục tốt đẹp hơn là lí do để hi vọng hiện giờ, và gửi lời thăm hỏi đến quyến thuộc của cô. Rồi chỉ với một tia nhìn từ giã trang nghiêm, anh ra về.
tr: Darcy onu saklayacağına temin etti –sıkıntısı için ne kadar üzgün olduğunu tekrarladı, halihazırda mümkün göründüğünden daha mutlu bir sonla neticelenmesini temenni etti ve akrabalarına selamlarını bırakıp, bir tek ciddi, ayrılık bakışıyla çıktı, gitti.
es: Darcy le prometió ser discreto, se condolió de nuevo por la desgracia, le deseó que el asunto no acabase tan mal como podía esperarse y encargándole que saludase a sus parientes se despidió sólo con una mirada, muy serio.
vi_translation: He eagerly promised her that he would keep it a secret. Then he expressed his sympathy for her sorrow, hoping for a better outcome than the current reason for hope, and sent his regards to her relatives. Then, with just a solemn farewell glance, he left.
tr_translation: Darcy assured her that he would keep it a secret – he repeated how sorry he was for her distress, wished for a happier ending than currently seemed possible, left his regards to her relatives, and with one serious, parting glance, he left.
es_translation: Darcy promised to be discreet, expressed his sympathy once again for the misfortune, wished that the matter would not end as badly as could be expected, and, asking him to send his regards to his relatives, took his leave with just a serious look.

en: “What is all settled?” repeated the other, as she ran into her room to prepare. “And are they upon such terms as for her to disclose the real truth? Oh, that I knew how it was!”
vi: Bà mợ lặp lại, khi bà chạy vào phòng để chuẩn bị: “Việc này đã được thu xếp xong. Và không hiểu hai người có thân thiết với nhau lắm không để cô cháu tiết lộ sự thật! Ôi, giá tôi đã biết tình cảnh ra sao!”
tr: "Herşey halledildi;" diye tekrarladı diğeri, hazırlanmak için odasına seğirtirken. "Gerçeği açıklayacak kadar yakınlar mı acaba! Ah keşke bilseydim!
es: Eso ya está arreglado. ––Eso ya está arreglado ––repitió la señora Gardiner mientras corría al otro cuarto a prepararse–. ¿Están en tan estrechas relaciones como para haberle revelado la verdad? ¡Cómo me gustaría descubrir lo que ha pasado!
vi_translation: The aunt repeated, as she ran into the room to prepare: "This matter has been arranged." And I don't know how close the two of you are for the niece to reveal the truth! Oh, if only I had known what the situation was like!”
tr_translation: "Everything is taken care of," repeated the other, darting to their room to get ready. "I wonder if they are close enough to reveal the truth! Oh, I wish I knew!"
es_translation: ––That's already been settled ––repeated Mrs. Gardiner as she ran to the other room to get ready–. Are they on such close terms as to have revealed the truth to him? How I would love to find out what has happened!

en: “Well, then,—supposing them to be in London—they may be there, though for the purpose of concealment, for no more exceptionable purpose. It is not likely that money should be very abundant on either side; and it might strike them that they could be more economically, though less expeditiously, married in London, than in Scotland.”
vi: - Được rồi, thế thì giả dụ họ đang ở tại London. Họ có thể ở đấy, với mục đích ẩn náu chứ không vì mục đích ngoại lệ khác. Mỗi người không thể có nhiều tiền, và họ nghĩ rằng họ có thể cưới nhau ít tốn kém, tuy chậm, ở London hơn là ở Scotland.
tr: "Pekala –varsayalım ki Londra'dalar. Saklanmak için orada olabilirler, ama başka bir istisnai sebepleri olamaz. İki tarafın da para içinde yüzüyor olma ihtimali yok; Londra'da İskoçya'dan daha acele değilse de daha ekonomik tarafından evlenebilecekleri akıllarına gelmiş olabilir.
es: ––Bueno, supongamos que están en Londres. Pueden no haberlo hecho más que con el propósito de ocultarse. No es probable que ninguno de los dos ande sobrado de dinero, y habrán creído que les saldría más barato casarse en Londres que en Escocia, aunque les sea más difícil.
vi_translation: - Alright, then suppose they are in London. They might be there for the purpose of hiding, not for any other exceptional reason. Each person might not have much money, and they think they can get married more cheaply, though slowly, in London than in Scotland.
tr_translation: "Alright – let's assume they are in London. They might be there to hide, but there can't be any other exceptional reason. It's unlikely that both sides are swimming in money; they might have thought that getting married in London would be more economical, if not more urgent, than in Scotland."
es_translation: ––Well, suppose they are in London. They may have done it only for the purpose of hiding. It is not likely that either of them has plenty of money, and they might have thought it would be cheaper to get married in London than in Scotland, even if it is more difficult for them.

en: The little Gardiners, attracted by the sight of a chaise, were standing on the steps of the house, as they entered the paddock; and when the carriage drove up to the door, the joyful surprise that lighted up their faces and displayed itself over their whole bodies, in a variety of capers and frisks, was the first pleasing earnest of their welcome.
vi: Các đứa trẻ nhà Gardiner đang đứng trên thềm nhà khi họ đánh xe vào, và khi chiếc xe chạy đến ngạch cửa, bọn trẻ mặt sáng lên, nhảy cỡn chào đón họ.
tr: Arabayı görünce heveslenen küçük Gardinerlar araba çimenliğe girdiğinde merdivene çıkmış, bekliyorlardı; araba kapıya yanaştığı zaman yüzlerini aydınlatan ve tüm vücutlarına yayılarak onları hoplatıp zıplatan neşeli şaşkınlık gelişlerinin yarattığı ilk sevinç belirtisi oldu.
es: Los pequeños Gardiner, atraídos al ver un carruaje, esperaban de pie en las escaleras de la casa mientras éste atravesaba el camino de entrada. Cuando el coche paró en la puerta, la alegre sorpresa que brillaba en sus rostros y retozaba por todo su cuerpo haciéndoles dar saltos, fue el preludio de su bienvenida.
vi_translation: The Gardiner children were standing on the doorstep when they drove in, and as the car reached the threshold, the children's faces lit up, jumping excitedly to greet them.
tr_translation: When they saw the car, the little Gardiners, who had eagerly climbed the steps as the car entered the lawn, were waiting; as the car approached the door, the joyful astonishment that lit up their faces and spread through their entire bodies, making them jump and bounce, was the first sign of the excitement caused by their arrival.
es_translation: The little Gardiners, drawn by the sight of a carriage, stood on the steps of the house as it made its way up the driveway. When the carriage stopped at the door, the joyful surprise that shone on their faces and made them jump around was the prelude to their welcome.

en: “Do not give way to useless alarm,” added he: “though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain. It is not quite a week since they left Brighton. In a few days more, we may gain some news of them; and till we know that they are not married, and have no design of marrying, do not let us give the matter over as lost. As soon as I get to town, I shall go to my brother, and make him come home with me to Gracechurch Street, and then we may consult together as to what is to be done.”
vi: Ông thêm: - Xin chị đừng hoảng hốt mà không ích lợi gì cả; mặc dù ta nên chuẩn bị cho tình huống xấu nhất nhưng không nên nghĩ sự việc chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra như thế. Hai người rời Brighton chưa được một tuần. Trong vòng vài ngày tới, chúng ta hi vọng nhận được ít tin tức về họ, và khi chúng ta chưa biết họ đã kết hôn hoặc có ý định kết hôn, thì chúng ta không nên nghĩ rằng đã mất tất cả. Khi tôi đến thành phố tôi sẽ đi gặp ngay anh tôi và mời anh ấy cùng đi với tôi đến phố Gracechurch, rồi chúng tôi sẽ bàn với nhau làm những gì.
tr: "Boş yere telaşa kapılma," diye ekledi, "en kötüye hazırlıklı olmak doğrudur, ama olmuş bitmiş görmenin de anlamı yok. Brighton'dan ayrılalı daha bir hafta olmadı. Birkaç gün daha geçsin, onlardan haber alırız; evlenmediklerini ve evlenmeyi düşünmediklerini öğrenene kadar meseleyi kaybetmiş saymayalım kendimizi. Şehre gider gitmez eniştemi bulur, onu alıp Gracechurch street'e, bizim eve götürürüm; sonra oturur ne yapacağımızı konuşuruz.
es: ––No os alarméis inútilmente ––añadió––; aunque bien está prepararse para lo peor, tampoco debe darse por seguro. Todavía no hace una semana que salieron de Brighton. En pocos días más averiguaremos algo; y hasta que no sepamos que no están casados y que no tienen intenciones de estarlo, no demos el asunto por perdido. En cuanto llegue a Londres recogeré a mi hermano y me lo llevaré a Gracechurch Street; juntos deliberaremos lo que haya que hacer.
vi_translation: He added: - Please don't panic as it won't do any good; although we should prepare for the worst-case scenario, we shouldn't think that it will definitely happen like that. The two people left Brighton less than a week ago. In the next few days, we hope to receive some news about them, and since we don't know if they have married or intend to marry, we shouldn't think that all is lost. When I get to the city, I will immediately go see my brother and invite him to go with me to Gracechurch Street, then we will discuss together what to do.
tr_translation: "Don't panic unnecessarily," he added, "it's right to be prepared for the worst, but there's no point in seeing it as a done deal. It hasn't even been a week since they left Brighton. Let's wait a few more days, we'll hear from them; until we learn that they haven't married and aren't planning to marry, let's not consider the matter lost. As soon as I get to the city, I'll find my uncle, take him to Gracechurch Street, to our house; then we'll sit down and discuss what we should do."
es_translation: ––Do not alarm yourselves needlessly ––he added––; although it is good to prepare for the worst, it should not be taken for granted. It has not even been a week since they left Brighton. In a few more days we will find out something; and until we know that they are not married and have no intentions of being so, let us not consider the matter lost. As soon as I arrive in London, I will pick up my brother and take him to Gracechurch Street; together we will deliberate on what needs to be done.

en: “This is a most unfortunate affair, and will probably be much talked of. But we must stem the tide of malice, and pour into the wounded bosoms of each other the balm of sisterly consolation.”
vi: - Đây là việc không may nhất, có lẽ sẽ được nói đến nhiều nhất. Nhưng chúng ta phải cố vượt qua ác tâm, và rót vào tấm lòng tổn thương của mỗi người niềm an ủi của tình chị em.
tr: "Çok talihsiz bir durum; muhtemelen çok konuşulacak. Ama kötülük rüzgarlarını durdurup birbirimizin yaralı göğüslerine kardeşlik tesellisinin merhemini sürmeliyiz.
es: Es un asunto muy desdichado y probablemente será muy comentado; pero hemos de sobreponernos a la oleada de la malicia y derramar sobre nuestros pechos heridos el bálsamo del consuelo fraternal.
vi_translation: - This is the most unfortunate event, and it will probably be talked about the most. But we must strive to overcome malice, and pour into each wounded heart the comfort of sisterly love.
tr_translation: "A very unfortunate situation; it will probably be talked about a lot. But we must stop the winds of evil and apply the balm of brotherhood's consolation to each other's wounded chests."
es_translation: It is a very unfortunate matter and will probably be much talked about; but we must overcome the wave of malice and pour the balm of fraternal comfort over our wounded hearts.

en: Every day at Longbourn was now a day of anxiety; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected. The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning’s impatience. Through letters, whatever of good or bad was to be told would be communicated; and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance.
vi: Mỗi ngày ở Longbourn giờ đây là một ngày lo âu, nhưng thời khắc nhiều lo âu nhất là giờ đưa thư. Họ đều bồn chồn chờ thư từ đưa đến. Qua thư từ, họ sẽ biết được tin tức dù xấu dù tốt, và mọi ngày kế đều mang hi vọng có những tin quan trọng mới.
tr: Her gün Longbourn'da şimdi bir endişe günüydü; ama her günün en endişeli kısmı postanın beklendiği zamandı. Mektupların gelişi her sabahki sabırsızlığın ilk büyük nesnesiydi. İyi kötü ne varsa mektuplar yoluyla anlatılıyordu ve takip eden her günün önemli haberler getirmesi bekleniyordu.
es: En Longbourn los días transcurrían con gran ansiedad, ansiedad que crecía con la llegada del correo. Todas las mañanas esperaban las cartas con impaciencia. Por carta habrían de saber la mala o buena marcha del asunto, y cada día creían que iban a recibir alguna noticia de importancia.
vi_translation: Each day at Longbourn now is a day of anxiety, but the most anxious time is the hour when the mail arrives. They are all restless waiting for the mail to be delivered. Through the letters, they will learn news whether good or bad, and each following day brings hope for new important news.
tr_translation: Every day at Longbourn was now a day of anxiety; but the most anxious part of each day was the time when the mail was expected. The arrival of letters was the first great object of impatience every morning. Whatever good or bad there was to be told was conveyed through letters, and each succeeding day was expected to bring important news.
es_translation: In Longbourn, the days passed with great anxiety, anxiety that grew with the arrival of the mail. Every morning they awaited the letters with impatience. By letter, they would learn of the good or bad progress of the matter, and each day they believed they would receive some important news.

en: Upon this information, they instantly passed through the hall once more, and ran across the lawn after their father, who was deliberately pursuing his way towards a small wood on one side of the paddock.
vi: Họ lập tức chạy trở lại qua tiền sảnh và vượt qua bãi cỏ, thấy ông bố đang đi về phía khoảnh rừng nhỏ.
tr: Bu bilgi üzerine bir kez daha holden geçip çimenlikten babalarına doğru koştular; babaları çayırın bir yanındaki ufak ormana doğru kararlı bir biçimde yürüyordu.
es: Jane y Elizabeth volvieron a atravesar el vestíbulo y, cruzando el césped, corrieron detrás de su padre que se encaminaba hacia un bosquecillo de al lado de la cerca.
vi_translation: They immediately ran back through the hall and across the lawn, seeing their father heading towards the small grove.
tr_translation: Upon receiving this information, they ran once more through the hall and across the lawn towards their father; their father was walking determinedly towards the small forest on one side of the meadow.
es_translation: Jane and Elizabeth crossed the hall again and, crossing the lawn, ran after their father who was heading towards a small grove beside the fence.

en: “At last I am able to send you some tidings of my niece, and such as, upon the whole, I hope will give you satisfaction. Soon after you left me on Saturday, I was fortunate enough to find out in what part of London they were. The particulars I reserve till we meet. It is enough to know they are discovered: I have seen them both——”
vi: Cuối cùng tôi có thể gửi đến ông anh vài tin tức về cháu gái của tôi, và nói chung, tôi hi vọng tin này sẽ làm anh vui. Sau khi anh ra về vào Thứ bảy, tôi đã may mắn tìm ra nơi hai người trú ngụ tại London. Tôi sẽ kể chi tiết khi chúng ta gặp lại nhau. Chỉ cần biết rằng tôi đã gặp hai người.”
tr: Sonunda sana yeğenimle ilgili memnun edici olduğunu umut ettiğim bazı haberler verebiliyorum. Cumartesi günü sen gittikten hemen sonra şans yüzüme güldü ve Londra'nın neresinde olduklarını öğrendim. Ayrıntıları buluşmamıza saklıyorum. Bulunduklarını bilmek yeter; ikisini de gördüm–
es: Por fin puedo enviarte noticias de mi sobrina, y tales, en conjunto, que espero te satisfagan. Poco después de haberte marchado tú el sábado, tuve la suerte de averiguar en qué parte de Londres se encontraban. Los detalles me los reservo para cuando nos veamos; bástete saber que ya están descubiertos; les he visto a los dos.
vi_translation: Finally, I can send you some news about my niece, and in general, I hope this news will make you happy. After you left on Saturday, I was fortunate to find out where the two of them were staying in London. I will tell you the details when we meet again. Just know that I have met the two of them."
tr_translation: Finally, I can give you some news about my nephew that I hope will be pleasing to you. Right after you left on Saturday, luck smiled upon me and I found out where they are in London. I'm saving the details for our meeting. Knowing where they are is enough; I saw both of them–"
es_translation: At last, I can send you news about my niece, and such news, overall, that I hope will satisfy you. Shortly after you left on Saturday, I was fortunate enough to find out where in London they were. I will reserve the details for when we see each other; suffice it to know that they have been discovered; I have seen both of them.

en: “Yes, yes, they must marry. There is nothing else to be done. But there are two things that I want very much to know:—one is, how much money your uncle has laid down to bring it about; and the other, how I am ever to pay him.”
vi: - Đúng, đúng, họ phải kết hôn. Không còn cách nào khác. Nhưng có hai việc bố rất muốn biết: việc thứ nhất là, cậu các con đã bỏ ra bao nhiêu tiền để dàn xếp việc này, và việc thứ hai, làm thế nào bố có thể trả lại cho ông ấy.
tr: "Evet, evet, evlenmeleri lazım. Yapacak başka bir şey yok. Ama bilmeyi çok istediğim iki şey var: –biri, bunları ortaya çıkarmak için dayın ne kadar para döktü, diğeri de ona bu parayı nasıl geri ödeyeceğim.
es: ––Sí, sí, deben casarse. No se puede hacer otra cosa. Pero hay dos puntos que quiero aclarar: primero, cuánto dinero ha adelantado tu tío para resolver eso, y segundo, cómo voy a pagárselo.
vi_translation: - Yes, yes, they must get married. There is no other way. But there are two things I really want to know: the first thing is, how much money did your uncle spend to arrange this, and the second thing is, how can I repay him.
tr_translation: "Yes, yes, they need to get married. There is no other choice. But there are two things I really want to know: –one, how much money your uncle spent to uncover these, and the other, how I will repay him this money."
es_translation: ––Yes, yes, they must get married. There is no other option. But there are two points I want to clarify: first, how much money your uncle has advanced to resolve this, and second, how I am going to pay him back.

en: He was seriously concerned that a cause of so little advantage to anyone should be forwarded at the sole expense of his brother-in-law; and he was determined, if possible, to find out the extent of his assistance, and to discharge the obligation as soon as he could.
vi: Ông lo nghĩ một cách nghiêm túc về việc người em vợ phải gánh chịu chi phí, và ông chủ định, nếu có thể, tìm hiểu số tiền mà người em vợ đã hỗ trợ, hầu ông có thể thanh toán món nợ càng sớm càng tốt.
tr: Kimseye pek bir faydası olmayan böyle bir amacın tüm maliyetinin kayınbiraderine düşmüş olması onu ciddi biçimde üzüyordu; mümkün olursa, yardımının miktarını öğrenmeye ve ilk fırsatta borcu tasfiye etmeye kararlıydı.
es: Estaba seriamente consternado de que por un asunto que tan pocas ventajas ofrecía para nadie, su cuñado tuviese que hacer tantos sacrificios, y quería averiguar el importe de su donativo a fin de devolvérselo cuando le fuese posible.
vi_translation: He seriously worried about his brother-in-law having to bear the costs, and he intended, if possible, to find out the amount his brother-in-law had supported, so that he could repay the debt as soon as possible.
tr_translation: He was seriously upset that the entire cost of such a purpose, which was of little benefit to anyone, had fallen on his brother-in-law; if possible, he was determined to find out the amount of his help and to settle the debt at the first opportunity.
es_translation: He was seriously dismayed that for a matter which offered so few advantages for anyone, his brother-in-law had to make so many sacrifices, and he wanted to find out the amount of his donation in order to repay him when possible.

en: What a triumph for him, as she often thought, could he know that the proposals which she had proudly spurned only four months ago would now have been gladly and gratefully received! He was as generous, she doubted not, as the most generous of his sex. But while he was mortal, there must be a triumph.
vi: Cô thường nghĩ, quả là một chiến thắng cho anh nếu anh biết rằng giờ cô có thể chấp nhận tình cảm mà cô đã hắt hủi một cách kiêu hãnh chỉ bốn tháng trước! Cô vẫn tin anh có tính phóng khoáng theo cách phóng khoáng nhất của đàn ông. Nhưng vì anh chỉ là một con người, anh vẫn có thể cảm thấy say men chiến thắng.
tr: Nasıl da zafer kazanmış olurdu, diye düşünüyordu sık sık, daha dört ay önce göğsünü gere gere reddettiği tekliflerin şimdi ne büyük bir sevinçle, minnettarlıkla kabul edileceğini bilseydi! Soylu bir adam olduğundan kuşkusu yoktu, hem de en soylulardan biri. Ama aynı zamanda insandı ve zafer duygusu hissedebilirdi.
es: «¡Qué triunfo para él ––pensaba–– si supiera que las proposiciones que deseché con tanto orgullo hace sólo cuatro meses, las recibiría ahora encantada.» No dudaba que era generoso como el que más, pero mientras viviese, aquello tenía que constituir para él un triunfo.
vi_translation: She often thought, it would indeed be a victory for him if he knew that now she could accept the feelings she had proudly rejected just four months ago! She still believed he had the most generous nature of any man. But because he was only human, he could still feel intoxicated by the triumph.
tr_translation: How victorious he would have been, he often thought, if only he had known that the offers he had proudly rejected just four months ago would now be accepted with such great joy and gratitude! There was no doubt that he was a noble man, and one of the noblest at that. But at the same time, he was human and could feel a sense of victory.
es_translation: "What a triumph for him," she thought, "if he knew that the proposals I so proudly rejected just four months ago, I would now gladly accept." He did not doubt that he was as generous as anyone, but as long as he lived, that had to be a triumph for him.

en: She began now to comprehend that he was exactly the man who, in disposition and talents, would most suit her. His understanding and temper, though unlike her own, would have answered all her wishes. It was an union that must have been to the advantage of both: by her ease and liveliness, his mind might have been softened, his manners improved; and from his judgment, information, and knowledge of the world, she must have received benefit of greater importance.
vi: Bây giờ cô bắt đầu nhận ra rằng anh chính là mẫu người hợp với cô nhất, xét theo tính khí và tài năng. Đầu óc hiểu biết và tư cách của anh, mặc dù không giống cô, đã đáp ứng mọi mong ước của cô. Đây là sự kết hợp có lợi cho cả hai: qua tính giản dị và sinh động của cô, tư cách của anh có thể trở thành mềm mỏng hơn, cách xử sự của anh có thể trở nên mực thước hơn; trong khi từ sự chín chắn và hiểu biết của anh, cô có thể lĩnh hội được nhiều điều quan trọng hơn.
tr: Şimdi onun kişiliği ve yetenekleriyle ona en uygun erkek olduğunu kavramaya başlıyordu. Aklı ve tabiatı onunkine benzemese de onun tüm dileklerine cevap veriyordu. Her ikisini de mutlu edecek bir beraberlikti bu; Elizabeth'in rahatlığı ve canlılığı onun karakterini yumuşatabilir, davranışlarını geliştirebilirdi; onun yargı yeteneği, bilgisi, görgüsü ise Elizabeth'e daha önemli şeyler öğretirdi.
es: Empezó entonces a comprender que Darcy era exactamente, por su modo de ser y su talento, el hombre que más le habría convenido. El entendimiento y el carácter de Darcy, aunque no semejantes a los suyos, habrían colmado todos sus deseos. Su unión habría sido ventajosa para ambos: con la soltura y la viveza de ella, el temperamento de él se habría suavizado y habrían mejorado sus modales. Y el juicio, la cultura y el conocimiento del mundo que él poseía le habrían reportado a ella importantes beneficios.
vi_translation: Now she began to realize that he was the person most suited to her, in terms of temperament and talent. His understanding and character, although different from hers, met all her desires. This was a mutually beneficial combination: through her simplicity and liveliness, his character could become more gentle, his behavior more measured; while from his maturity and knowledge, she could learn many more important things.
tr_translation: Now she was beginning to realize that he was the most suitable man for her, with his personality and abilities. Even though his mind and nature were not similar to hers, he fulfilled all her wishes. This was a relationship that would make both of them happy; Elizabeth's ease and liveliness could soften his character and improve his behavior; his judgment, knowledge, and experience would teach Elizabeth more important things.
es_translation: Then she began to understand that Darcy was exactly, by his way of being and his talent, the man who would have suited her best.
